io.smudgr.app

Class AppStart

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.smudgr.app.AppStart
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChannelBleedTest, EricTestMain, EricUiTest, KinectTest, PiTest, RainbowBendTest, SampleApp, SkyShowApp, smudgr

    public abstract class AppStart
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract AppStart class defines generic behavior for bootstrapping an application instance, mostly for testing purposes. Basically this class is total garbage and is gonna be totally trashed by the time we go live.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppStart

        public AppStart(java.lang.String projectPath,
                java.lang.String sourceLocation,
                java.lang.String outputDir,
                java.lang.String device,
                boolean overwriteSmudge,
                boolean deviceServer)
        Parameters:
        projectPath - project to load
        sourceLocation - sources to load
        outputDir - where to record
        device - MIDI controller to bind to
        overwriteSmudge - Whether to delete the existing project file on application start
        deviceServer - Whether to start a MIDI device server

      • bind

        public void bind(Controllable c)
        Register a control to bind to a MIDI input on start
        Parameters:
        c - Controllable could be a Parameter or AppControl

      • bind

        public void bind(Controllable c,
                 boolean absolute,
                 int ignoreKey)
        Register a control to bind to a MIDI input
        Parameters:
        c - Controllable
        absolute - Should a knob input be absolute (0-127) or relative (knob up increments, knob down decrements)
        ignoreKey - Optional key to ignore (not bind if accidentally pressed)
